metadata.title: Disable TCP forwarding
metadata.description: AllowTcpForwarding allows users to create tunnels via the SSH service. This could allow an attacker to bypass ACL or firewall rules. Therefore, such tunneling poses a threat to the organisation as it could allow data exfiltration. Consequently, it should be disabled unless it is explicitly required.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: file /etc/ssh/sshd_config must have a line that matches ^AllowTcpForwarding.*no
